H0.text: Franz Liszt ended up the father-in-law to which other very famous composer. Brahms

H1.text: Franz Liszt ended up the father-in-law to which other very famous composer. Tchaikovsky

H2.text: Franz Liszt ended up the father-in-law to which other very famous composer. Mahler

H3.text: Franz Liszt ended up the father-in-law to which other very famous composer. Wagner

A4.text: Liszt initially disapproved of his daughter's involvement with Wagner, though nevertheless the two men were friends.

A5.text: Cosima was 24 years younger than Wagner and was herself illegitimate, the daughter of the Countess Marie d'Agoult, who had left her husband for Franz Liszt.
